caption: Figure 1: Overview of the JMMMU dataset. JMMMU includes 720 culture-agnostic (translation-based) questions and 600 culture-specific (newly created) questions, totaling 1,320 questions, thus expanding the existing culture-aware Japanese benchmark (Inoue et al., 2024b) by over 10 times. JMMMU serves as a diagnostic tool for assessing both Japanese cultural understanding and culture-agnostic language understanding capability.
description: The figure shows an overview of the JMMMU dataset, illustrating its composition of culture-agnostic and culture-specific questions, along with the number of questions and images, and their distribution across different subjects.

caption: Figure E: Examples in culture-specific subjects. The questions are created by Japanese native speakers and requires knowledge of Japanese culture.
description: Figure E shows example questions from the culture-specific subset of the JMMMU benchmark, highlighting their focus on Japanese cultural knowledge.

caption: Figure 6: Examples from each error type: (a) Lack of Knowledge, where the model does not know the necessary information; (b) Image Recognition Errors, where the model fails to correctly interpret the image; (c) Answer Rejection, where the model rejects to answer; and (d) Textual Misunderstanding, where the response is not aligned with the question.
description: Figure 6 presents four example questions from the JMMMU benchmark to illustrate the four main error categories identified when evaluating LMMs on the benchmark.
